intro: Oenothera deltoides var. cineracea, commonly known as the silverleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery, fuzzy foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Its stems are typically erect and branched, while its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, white pubescence. The species is also notable for its medicinal uses, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
